title: Cyclotomic polynomial
summary: In mathematics, the nth cyclotomic polynomial, for any positive integer n, is the unique irreducible polynomial with integer coefficients that is a divisor of x n − 1 {\displaystyle x^{n}-1} and is not a divisor of x k − 1 {\displaystyle x^{k}-1} for any k < n. Its roots are all nth primitive roots of unity e 2 i π k n {\displaystyle e^{2i\pi {\frac {k}{n}}}} , where k runs over the positive integers not greater than n and coprime to n (and i is the imaginary unit).
